Articles.Content:
They're the same as mk2 parts...

Yes on paper. But in testing they survived direct hits with missiles going 150+ m/s, which just bounced off. Interestingly, most of the interior parts were destroyed but not the cargo bay, though, I was using a quick test ship that was poorly designed and reinforced.

Edit: they're very unpredictable in what will happen. Usually it results in many parts on the ship becoming disconnected but not destroyed...

Edited December 16, 2014 by sdj64

Sweet as! Here, mor eye candy. My first attempt at a bridge. Ratings?

Sweet as! Here, mor eye candy. My first attempt at a bridge. Ratings? http://i.imgur.com/lr8fBvX.png http://i.imgur.com/v7pwnAf.png http://i.imgur.com/aVz3T3g.png http://i.imgur.com/obdoUUC.png

Try a slightly lower profile bridge, with some angling. That's how I got the KDX 3 bridge, by blending it into the main hull.

Ah. Makes sense. My deck slopes upwards instead of inwards though. Why not you see what you can do with it? Try to stay under 700 parts though. I dont need it to be armed as well. Also, the test wheels i used to try and get it into the water are still there.

Edited December 17, 2014 by ejudedude13

Ah. Makes sense. My deck slopes upwards instead of inwards though

I have an old up-slope blended-hull ship called the UKN Perry, which was under 300 parts. I'd ask EladDV for some pics (he used it as a naval target). (I just don't have the time to go that deep into my posting history atm)

I'm going to wrev up my tank development in conjunction with improved blocks of the SU-30. That's an album of KATEC's ancient K-2 Black Panther.

EDIT: I actually can't turn on KSP (the desktop) because of finals atm. I'll see what I can do on Saturday, if I can get the time.

EDIT II: I actually found an old picture. This was after a 0.625m armor piercing missiles test with a tandem warhead and solid boosters for terminal approach. I'll have to remake that AGM-65.

Does the track target function work for missiles? It could make long range missiles easier to use.

Does the track target function work for missiles? It could make long range missiles easier to use.

None of the .5m probe cores have the function.

None of the .5m probe cores have the function.

I was just using said function with the flat Okto core?

I was just using said function with the flat Okto core?

Really, maybe the limits are just for career mode?

Really, maybe the limits are just for career mode?

Yeah I think so..

I sorta tried the boat again.

Is it too narrow?
It certainly doesn't look stable.

Alright well, the computer repair guys f**ked up and didn't get the Vegas File or any of the correct footage out of my computer, so unfortunately I cannot complete that anytime soon... Anyone have any ideas for a Christmas Special video?

The design so far:

Now I need to work on weapons. How would I do that....

Well, you could always send a christmas tree to jool! (thats always fun)

From one of your good fans.

Good luck with the channel!

Tops out at 6m/s and at 1/3 throttle. any faster and the fuel tanks destroy themselves.. Im trying to keep the part count below 600, but i need the intakes on the bottom to protect the engines.

Mr Tegu - Holy Lag-balls! THAT station. Your Warships/Starships look like Icing on a beautiful cake which is your Space Station! Just look at that! That's what I was trying to build, unfortunately I'm only limited by my laptop computer.

This is the best that I could do without too much Lag. I only stopped because it's getting to slow.

Zamo, your space station reminds me of the Argus Array

Zamo, your space station reminds me of the Argus Array

http://img1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20111109002901/memoryalpha/en/images/1/1c/Argus.jpg

daemonCaptrix I get that a lot. I don't even know what an Argus Array is in the first place when people talk about it. (I googled it after, then learned about it) The hexagon station is a common design I guess.

I've been reading your thread on daeCorp, GREAT ships! (I'm still reading right now) I'll give you a rep
